Class InvestmentSimulator

java.lang.Object
simulation.Simulator
simulation.InvestmentSimulator
public class InvestmentSimulator extends Simulator
Simulates personal stock investments in a controlled market environment.

This concrete subclass of Simulator models an individual user's investment experience, including buying and selling stocks, tracking holdings, and calculating profits or losses based on stock price changes over time.

It manages a user's balance, portfolio holdings, and facilitates transactions such as purchasing and selling shares. This class supports simulations for both standard investment and day trading modes using relevant UI screens.

The InvestmentSimulator is useful for testing portfolio strategies and evaluating simulated investment outcomes.

  • Method Details

    • buy

      public static boolean buy(StockData[] data, String ticker, int amount)
      Attempts to buy a specified amount of shares of a stock in standard simulation mode. Deducts the purchase cost from the balance and adds a new holding if successful.
      Parameters:
      data - array of stock data for available stocks
      ticker - the stock symbol to purchase
      amount - the number of shares to buy
      Returns:
      true if the purchase was successful (enough balance), false otherwise

    • DTBuy

      public static boolean DTBuy(StockData[] data, String ticker, int amount)
      Attempts to buy a specified amount of shares of a stock in day trading mode. Deducts the purchase cost from the balance and adds a new holding if successful.
      Parameters:
      data - array of stock data for available stocks
      ticker - the stock symbol to purchase
      amount - the number of shares to buy
      Returns:
      true if the purchase was successful (enough balance), false otherwise

    • sell

      public static boolean sell(StockData[] data, String ticker, int amount)
      Attempts to sell a specified amount of shares of a stock in standard simulation mode. Updates the balance and holdings accordingly if enough shares are owned.
      Parameters:
      data - array of stock data for available stocks
      ticker - the stock symbol to sell
      amount - the number of shares to sell
      Returns:
      true if the sale was successful (enough shares owned), false otherwise

    • DTSell

      public static boolean DTSell(StockData[] data, String ticker, int amount)
      Attempts to sell a specified amount of shares of a stock in day trading mode. Updates the balance and holdings accordingly if enough shares are owned.
      Parameters:
      data - array of stock data for available stocks
      ticker - the stock symbol to sell
      amount - the number of shares to sell
      Returns:
      true if the sale was successful (enough shares owned), false otherwise

    • getBalance

      public static double getBalance()
      Returns the current available balance for investing.
      Returns:
      the user's current cash balance

    • resetBalance

      public static void resetBalance()
      Resets the user's balance to the initial default value (10000).

    • getHoldingsOfTicker

      public static int getHoldingsOfTicker(String ticker)
      Returns the total number of shares held for a specific stock ticker.
      Parameters:
      ticker - the stock symbol to check
      Returns:
      the sum of shares held for the given ticker
